data.title: Taxation of expatriates in selected jurisdictions : Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, Israel, Japan, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Korea, United Kingdom
data.meta_description: "July 2015." "LL file no.  2015-012554" Includes bibliographical references. Description based on online resource; title from PDF caption (Law Library of Congress, viewed Oct. 13, 2020).
data.text:
Publications of the Law Library of Congress are works of the United States Government as defined in the United States Code 17 U.S.C. ยง105 and therefore are not subject to copyright and are free to use and reuse. The Library of Congress has no objection to the international use and reuse of Library U.S. Government works on loc.gov. These works are also available for worldwide use and reuse under CC0 1.0 Universal.

However, copyright protections may apply to copyrighted images or material from a third party that is contained in the publication. Responsibility for making an independent legal assessment of an item and securing any necessary permissions ultimately rests with persons desiring to use the item. You are responsible for deciding whether your use of the items in this collection is legal. You will need written permission from the rightsholders to copy, distribute, or otherwise use copyrighted materials except as allowed by fair use or other statutory exemptions. Some materials may be protected under international law. You may also need permission from holders of other rights, such as publicity and/or privacy rights.
